q: One of the justifications that Google provided for former CEO Eric Schmidt 's move into the chairman role and the a new cover story on the company, which describes how Google is trying to save itself from the ossification that can paralyze large corporations. But what if Google's biggest problem isn't a lack of flexibility or the speed of its decision-making, but a fundamental cultural inability to create new lines of business that can keep the company growing? I'm very personally excited about my next decade at Google, Eric Schmidt , who oversaw Google's meteoric rise, told the DLD media conference in Munich on Tuesday. He told Reuters on January 21 that his move was an effort to speed up decision-making.

San Francisco- Chrysler CEO Sergio Marchionne says the company will run a two-minute commercial in the third quarter of the Super Bowl on Sunday, as part of the company's efforts to recast its image. I won't tell you what it's about but its worth watching, Sergio Marchionne said at a forum sponsored by JD Power at a hotel here ahead of the National Automobile Dealers Association three-day convention. ( perhaps bankruptcy). Some elected officials, like California Treasurer Bill Lockyer , say states don't need the ability to file bankruptcy because they have permanent revenue sources: taxpayers. Bill Lockyer told Reuters that states have the ability to enact a tax, and that's not the case of these private corporations that may have unfunded obligations that they can't deal with. That seems to be the consensus among too many politicians: Just raise taxes to deal with our ill-advised promises to government workers.
